car.shared.config
Class Config

java.lang.Object
  car.shared.config.Config
All Implemented Interfaces:
com.google.gwt.event.logical.shared.HasValueChangeHandlers<java.lang.Boolean>, com.google.gwt.event.shared.HasHandlers
Direct Known Subclasses:
OrientorConfig
public class Config
extends java.lang.Object
implements com.google.gwt.event.logical.shared.HasValueChangeHandlers<java.lang.Boolean>

This is the class that is responsible for loading configuration information for the Car Orientor project. The configuration must be specified in an external XML file. The Config will also automatically load and parse each referenced wire-frame resource. By default, the class will automatically load a configuration file from a default location. All loading is asynchronous, and one should call isLoaded() before using an instance for the first time to make sure everything is loaded. When the Config is finished loading, it will fire a ValueChangeEvent with a value of true, if the requested configuration file could be loaded, or false if it could not and a fallback state was loaded. When extending this class, load() should be overrided with the custom parsing, and fallback() should be overriden to provide a fallback state in case parsing fails. Once one has finished loading or setting up a fallback state, one should call doneLoading() to fire the loaded event and set the loaded flag to true.

Author:
Joshua Little

Constructor Detail

Config

public Config(java.lang.String url)
Creates a new Config from the file at the specified URL. If the configuration file cannot be loaded (e.g., it does not exist), then the Config is set up by calling fallback().

Parameters:
url - the location of the configuration file to load.
Throws:
java.lang.RuntimeException - if there was an error requesting the file.
Method Detail

get

public static Config get()
Returns the singleton Config instance representing the default configuration.

Returns:
the default Config.

isLoaded

public boolean isLoaded()
Returns whether this Config is fully loaded or not.

Returns:
true if it is fully loaded, false otherwise.

setLoaded

private void setLoaded(boolean success)
Sets the loaded attribute and fires the loaded event.

Parameters:
success - whether the requested configuration file could be loaded.

hasForm

public boolean hasForm()
Returns whether the configuration file defined form information. If this method returns false. Then getFormMethod() and getFormAction() will both return null if false. Otherwise, they will both return non-null values.

Returns:
true, if there's form information, false otherwise.

getFormMethod

public java.lang.String getFormMethod()
Returns the form method defined in the configuration file. If no form was defined, will return null. If a form was defined, but no method declared, will return "GET".

Returns:
the form method, or null.

getFormAction

public java.lang.String getFormAction()
Returns the form action defined in the configuration file. If no form was defined, will return null. If a form was defined, but no action declared, will return the empty String.

Returns:
the form action, or null.

getFormTarget

public java.lang.String getFormTarget()
Returns the form target defined in the configuration file. If no form was defined, will return null. If a form was defined, but no target declared, will return "_self".

Returns:
the form action, or null.

getXMLDoc

protected com.google.gwt.xml.client.Document getXMLDoc()
Returns the underlying XML Document for this Config . Can be used to load custom properties.

Returns:
the underlying XML Document

loadConfig

private void loadConfig(java.lang.String url)
Retrieves and parses the configuration file at the specified URL. Calls finishFallback() if loading fails.

Parameters:
url - the location of the file to load.
Throws:
java.lang.RuntimeException - if there was an error requesting the file.

parseConfig

private void parseConfig(java.lang.String content)
Parses the supplied content into a XML document.

Parameters:
content - the XML file's content to parse.
Throws:
com.google.gwt.xml.client.impl.DOMParseException - if the content does not represent a parsable XML file.

load

protected void load()
Hook for subclasses to provide custom parsing. Called once the XML document has been created, but before the loaded event is fired. isLoaded() should return false while still within this method. Currently just calls doneLoading().

fallback

protected void fallback()
Hook for subclasses to provide a default fallback state if loading config loading fails. Note that if this function was called due to an exception propagating out of a subclass's load() method, the subclass's data might be in an inconsistent state. The base class Config should be in a consistant state, however. Currently just calls doneLoading().

finishLoading

private void finishLoading()
Finishes loading this Config after the XML configuration file has been retrieved. Calls load() so subclasses can extract the needed data.

finishFallback

private void finishFallback()
Finishes loading this Config into its fallback state after loading fails. Calls fallback() so subclasses can construct their own fallback state.

loadForm

private void loadForm()
Loads form information from the XML document. If no form tag is present, sets hasForm to false Otherwise, sets hasForm to true and sets each form parameter either to its specified value, or to its default value if no value is specified.

getElementText

private java.lang.String getElementText(com.google.gwt.xml.client.Element element,
                                        java.lang.String name,
                                        java.lang.String def)
Returns the text content of the named subelement of the specified element. If no subelement with the supplied name exists, returns the supplied default value.

Parameters:
element - the element to search in.
name - the name of the element to search for.
def - the default value if no specified value can be found.
Returns:
the specified value, or the default value if none exists.

doneLoading

protected void doneLoading()
Fires loaded event. To be called by subclasses when they've finished setting up their state.

fireEvent

public void fireEvent(com.google.gwt.event.shared.GwtEvent<?> event)
